pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity module¶

@author: sorr

This module contains the main subclasses for the classes in pyCoalesce.classes.entity. Applications should import these subclasses, rather than the base classes in the entity module. All subclasses can be imported directly from the pyCoalesce.classes module.

Both entity and this module were autogenerated from Coalesce’s entity XSD by the generateDS package, and then custom code was added to this module. The structure of these modules allows entity to be re-generated from an updated XSD without overwriting the custom code.

The convoluted structure of the code generated by entity produces two notable quirks:

  • The names of the subclasses can’t be changed, because the methods in entity use introspection to call them, and in order for this to work, they must follow the pattern “<original_class>Sub”. To overcoming this limitation, each subclass has been aliased with a more meaningful name, and the code elsewhere in the pyCoalesce package references these aliases.
  • Some of the functions and methods in this module and the other pyCoalesce.classes modules don’t work properly with iPython’s auto-reload feature. In most cases, these problems can be overcome by restarting the kernel and reimporting everything at once, though even this workaround may not solve the problem in a few cases.
pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity.DATA_TYPE_MAP = {'boolean': <type 'bool'>, 'double': <type 'float'>, 'float': <type 'float'>, 'int': <type 'int'>, 'long': <type 'long'>, 'short': <type 'int'>, 'string': <type 'unicode'>, 'stringlist': <type 'list'>}¶

Maps XSD types to Python types.

pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity.LINKAGE_TYPES = {'CREATED': 'Created', 'CROSS_DOMAIN_SOURCE': 'CrossDomainSource', 'CROSS_DOMAIN_TARGET': 'CrossDomainTarget', 'HAS_INPUT_OF': 'HasInputOf', 'HAS_INPUT_PARAMETER_OF': 'HasInputParameterOf', 'HAS_MEMBER': 'HasMember', 'HAS_OUTPUT_OF': 'HasOutputOF', 'HAS_OWNERSHIP_OF': 'HasOwnershipOf', 'HAS_PARTICIPANT': 'HasParticipant', 'HAS_PRODUCT': 'HasProduct', 'HAS_USE_OF': 'HasUseOf', 'IS_A_MEMBER_OF': 'IsAMemberOf', 'IS_A_PARTICIPANT_OF': 'IsAParticipantOf', 'IS_A_PEER_OF': 'IsAPeerOf', 'IS_BEING_WATCHED_BY': 'IsBeingWatchedBy', 'IS_CHILD_OF': 'IsChildOf', 'IS_INPUT_PARAMETER_TO': 'IsInputParameterTo', 'IS_INPUT_TO': 'IsInputTo', 'IS_OUTPUT_TO': 'IsOutputTo', 'IS_OWNED_BY': 'IsOwnedBy', 'IS_PARENT_OF': 'IsParentOf', 'IS_PRODUCT_OF': 'IsProductOf', 'IS_USED_BY': 'IsUsedBy', 'IS_WATCHING': 'IsWatching', 'PREDECESSOR': 'Predecessor', 'SUCCESSOR': 'Successor', 'UNDEFINED': 'Undefined', 'WAS_CREATED_BY': 'WasCreatedBy'}¶

The Coalesce XML and JSON API’s use different values for the same link types; the keys are the JSON versions, and the values are the XML versions. Eventually, this map should be available through the “property” API , at which point it can be downloaded rather than hard-coded.

Bases: pyCoalesce.classes.entity.linkage

buildAttributes(node, attrs, already_processed)¶

Adds a check for valid link type to the parent method.

to_API(biDirectional=False)¶

Returns a version of the linkage as a (JSON-serializable) instance of pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_json.CoalesceAPILinkage.

Parameters:bidirectional – a boolean indicating whether or not the server should create a second linkage, from entity2 to entity1.
Returns:the linkage as an instance of CoalesceAPILinkage

Bases: pyCoalesce.classes.entity.linkagesection

pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity.CoalesceLinkageSection¶

alias of pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity.linkagesectionSub

class pyCoalesce.classes.coalesce_entity.entitySub(key=None, title=None, name=None, source=None, version=None, linkagesection=None, section=None, noindex=None, disablehistory=None, datecreated=None, entityid=None, entityidtype=None)¶

Bases: pyCoalesce.classes.entity.entity

Variables:
  • key – a UUID key as a string. Supplying a key is optional for a newly created entity; if none is supplied, the server generates one randomly.
  • title – the entity’s title (if any–some types of entities use a record field instead); not to be confused with the entity’s template name
  • name – the name of the entity’s template; with source and version, one of the three attributes that uniquely identify the template
  • source – the source (e.g., a particular project) of the entity’s template; with name and version, one of the three attributes that uniquely identify the template
  • version – the version of the entity’s template; with name and version, one of the three attributes that uniquely identify the template
  • linkagesection – a child object of class CoalesceLinkageSection that contains the entity’s linkages
  • section – a list of the entity’s sections
  • noindex – a boolean indicating whether or not to index the entity for search
  • disablehistory – a boolean that serves as a default value for the same attribute for entities created from the template, specifying whether or not each entity’s history of revisions should be retained
  • datecreated – the date on which the entity was created. If not specified, this attribute will be set by the server.
  • template – the CoalesceEntityTemplate used to create the entity, if the entity was created via the template’s new_entity() method. If the entity was created in any other fashion, the value of this attribute is None.
  • entityid – a unique, searchable ID used by some specific applications
  • entityidtype – the type of entityid in use
  • status – the current status (active or deleted) of the entity (set by the server)
  • lastmodified – the date on which the entity was last modified (set by the server)
  • modifiedby – the last user to modify the entity (set by the server)
  • modifiedbyip – the ip of the last user to modify the entity (set by the server)
  • objectversion – the version (revision) of the entity (set by the server); not to be confused with entity’s template attr:’version’
  • objectversionstatus – the current status (active or deleted) of the version (revision) of the entity (set by the server)
  • previoushistorykey – the UUID key of the previous history of the entity (set by the server)
  • history – the history of the entity’s revisions (set by the server)
